channel.title: Dear audiophiles, help me setup my sound system!
channel.description:
Alright, I'm having a party this Friday, and what's a party without music? I have tons of speakers that I've collected over time, all in good and working condition, however, I'm trying to figure out how to arrange them in an acceptable manner so that I get even quality and some awesome bass. I want everything to shake! Here's what I have..
[b]The party room[/b]
[ul][li]Concrete floors.[/li] [li]50ft x 25ft - Walls are about 9ft high.[/li][/ul]
[b]Receivers, Amplifiers, and Equalizers[/b]
[ul][li]Denon 7.1 surround receiver (~450wpc if I remember right)[/li] [li]Yamaha 7.1 surround receiver (~350wpc)[/li] [li]Pre-amplifier/3-band equalizer[/li] [li]Amplifier (~200wpc)[/li] [li]12-band Equalizer (don't remember the maker)[/li][/ul]
[b]Tower Speakers[/b]
[ul][li]2x JBL Tower Speakers (8-inch poly cone woofer, 4-inch mid-range, 1.5 inch polycell tweeter)[/li] [li]2x Sony Tower Speakers (12-inch woofer, 3-inch mid-range, 2-inch tweeters - PER SPEAKER)[/li] [li]2x Kenwood Tower Spekaers (12-inch woofer, 3-inch mid-range, 1-inch tweeters - PER SPEAKER)[/li][/ul]
[b]Surround Speakers[/b]
[ul][li]2x KLH (about 6in. x 6in.)[/li] [li]4x RCA (small 4in. x 4in. surround speakers - provide excellent noise)[/li] [li]5x Yamaha (small 4in. x 4in. surround speakers - also go very loud without distortion)[/li][/ul]
[b]Center Speakers[/b]
[ul][li]JBL Center Speaker (contains two 2-inch speakers)[/li] [li]Yamaha Center Speakers (has five 2-inch speakers inside)[/li][/ul]
[b]Subwoofers[/b]
[ul][li]TheaterSolutions 6-inch powered subwoofer (small but supplies a nice amount of bass for the size)[/li] [li]RCA 6-inch 125-watt subwoofer (decent sized, supplied good amount of bass)[/li] [li]Kenwood 12-inch 250-watt subwoofer (shakes absolutely everything)[/li] [li]Insignia 8-inch subwoofer (gives quite a bit of bass when powered well)[/li][/ul]
[b]Other[/b]
[ul][li]I had a MTX center channel that is about 20in. wide x 8in. tall x 6in. deep, the midranges in it blew out, instead of replacing it with other midranges, I put in two 4-inch high performance subwoofers in it, this "center channel" also has a 1-inch high output tweeter. The subwoofers in it have 150-watts going to each. Shakes stuff, a lot.[/li] [li]Plenty of thick gauge speaker wire.[/li] [li]Music will be played off my phone with a 12-band equalizer on my phone.[/li][/ul]
I can tune the speakers and make it sound nice, I'm just not where to place the speakers to make them sound best. As far as tower speakers, the two JBLs with 8-inch subwoofers are by far the most powerful ones, next comes the Sony's with 12-inch woofers, then the Kenwoods with 12-inch woofers, the Sony's and Kenwood's are pretty equal power wise though.
If any of you have suggestions, let me know. If you need more information, it's no problem, just ask!

item.title: Dear audiophiles, help me setup my sound system!
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Alright, I’m having a party this Friday, and what’s a party without music? I have tons of speakers that I’ve collected over time, all in good and working condition, however, I’m trying to figure out how to arrange them in an acceptable manner so that I get even quality and some awesome bass. I want everything to shake! Here’s what I have…

The party room

[ul][li]Concrete floors.[/li]
[li]50ft x 25ft - Walls are about 9ft high.[/li][/ul]

Receivers, Amplifiers, and Equalizers

[ul][li]Denon 7.1 surround receiver (~450wpc if I remember right)[/li]
[li]Yamaha 7.1 surround receiver (~350wpc)[/li]
[li]Pre-amplifier/3-band equalizer[/li]
[li]Amplifier (~200wpc)[/li]
[li]12-band Equalizer (don’t remember the maker)[/li][/ul]

Tower Speakers

[ul][li]2x JBL Tower Speakers (8-inch poly cone woofer, 4-inch mid-range, 1.5 inch polycell tweeter)[/li]
[li]2x Sony Tower Speakers (12-inch woofer, 3-inch mid-range, 2-inch tweeters - PER SPEAKER)[/li]
[li]2x Kenwood Tower Spekaers (12-inch woofer, 3-inch mid-range, 1-inch tweeters - PER SPEAKER)[/li][/ul]

Surround Speakers

[ul][li]2x KLH (about 6in. x 6in.)[/li]
[li]4x RCA (small 4in. x 4in. surround speakers - provide excellent noise)[/li]
[li]5x Yamaha (small 4in. x 4in. surround speakers - also go very loud without distortion)[/li][/ul]

Center Speakers

[ul][li]JBL Center Speaker (contains two 2-inch speakers)[/li]
[li]Yamaha Center Speakers (has five 2-inch speakers inside)[/li][/ul]

Subwoofers

[ul][li]TheaterSolutions 6-inch powered subwoofer (small but supplies a nice amount of bass for the size)[/li]
[li]RCA 6-inch 125-watt subwoofer (decent sized, supplied good amount of bass)[/li]
[li]Kenwood 12-inch 250-watt subwoofer (shakes absolutely everything)[/li]
[li]Insignia 8-inch subwoofer (gives quite a bit of bass when powered well)[/li][/ul]

Other

[ul][li]I had a MTX center channel that is about 20in. wide x 8in. tall x 6in. deep, the midranges in it blew out, instead of replacing it with other midranges, I put in two 4-inch high performance subwoofers in it, this “center channel” also has a 1-inch high output tweeter. The subwoofers in it have 150-watts going to each. Shakes stuff, a lot.[/li]
[li]Plenty of thick gauge speaker wire.[/li]
[li]Music will be played off my phone with a 12-band equalizer on my phone.[/li][/ul]

I can tune the speakers and make it sound nice, I’m just not where to place the speakers to make them sound best. As far as tower speakers, the two JBLs with 8-inch subwoofers are by far the most powerful ones, next comes the Sony’s with 12-inch woofers, then the Kenwoods with 12-inch woofers, the Sony’s and Kenwood’s are pretty equal power wise though.

If any of you have suggestions, let me know. If you need more information, it’s no problem, just ask!

item.source: Dear audiophiles, help me setup my sound system!
